feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a working financial application: a React web app that displays congressional trades, shows tickers/transaction ranges, performs AI analysis, and compares trades to user portfolios (evidence in Implement/demo). Discover and Implement stages show clear problem framing and a functioning implementation; Reflect confirms integration with financial data — meeting the PASS standard.
- Integrate AI: The student demonstrates concrete, non-superficial AI integration (AI-powered analyses tied to portfolio context and trade-level insights) and describes real implementation work (integration of quad AI, multiple iterations, API key troubleshooting). Discover, Implement, and Reflect evidence together show a thorough, functional integration rather than a superficial mention.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "So I wanted to build an app and that's why I built the Capital Trades tracking app."
"So then I integrated quad AI to provide a real-time analysis of each of these politicians behaviors."

"So I built a React web app with a clean interface that anyone can use... you can see 36 most regional congressional trades... it also provides the stock ticker name and the company name... I'm going to click on this and it'll do an AI analysis down here and it'll analyze my trade."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover: identified the problem (scattered congressional trade data) and proposed an app solution; Implement: integrated quad AI, built a React web app, and populated it with 36–40 trades demonstrating functionality; Reflect: described lessons about integrating AI APIs and working with real financial data, confirming practical application.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a working financial application: a React web app that displays congressional trades, shows tickers/transaction ranges, performs AI analysis, and compares trades to user portfolios (evidence in Implement/demo). Discover and Implement stages show clear problem framing and a functioning implementation; Reflect confirms integration with financial data — meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "it's an AI powered tool that not only shows you what politicians are trading, but it analyzes whether those trades make sense for your portfolio and how they fit into it."
"So then I integrated quad AI to provide a real-time analysis of each of these politicians behaviors."
"what I learned from this project and how to integrate AI APIs into financial applications and how to work with real financial data that actually impacts outcomes of millions of Americans worldwide."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: identified the problem of scattered, context-less congressional trade data motivating an AI solution.
- Implement: explicitly integrated "quad AI," iterated through multiple versions and resolved API/key issues to produce a working React app with real-time analysis.
- Reflect: articulated lessons learned about integrating AI APIs and how AI converts raw data into actionable insights.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates concrete, non-superficial AI integration (AI-powered analyses tied to portfolio context and trade-level insights) and describes real implementation work (integration of quad AI, multiple iterations, API key troubleshooting). Discover, Implement, and Reflect evidence together show a thorough, functional integration rather than a superficial mention.
